page.title: 16The Cattistock Hunt
page.content: Started at the close of the 18th century by the Rev. W. Philips, the Cattistock Hunt still exists.The Kennels, Stables and Kennel houses are owned by Lord Digby and rented to the Hunt along with about 40 acres. At present, 40 couples of hounds and 12 horses are maintained by the Hunt. There are three Joint Masters, and staff consisting of Kennel Huntsman/1st Whipper-in; 2nd Whipper-in; Kennelman; Terrierman/Fencer; Head Girl Groom and three Gorl Grooms. Linked by name to the Hunt is "H.M.S. Cattistock", a Hunt-class Minesweeper recently acquired by the Royal Navy and adopted by the village. There is also a Cattistock Branch of the Pony Club. Foxhunting takes place between early autumn and late spring.
